page.title: 19CLUBS AROUND OSSINGTON (2).
page.content: The building in Ossington which is used as a meeting place is referred to as the{'Hut'.}It is made up of two First World War army barrack huts, which were originally sited at Clipstone. At the end of the war, they were dismantled and re-erected in Ossington to make one building to be used by the villagers. Social functions such as the annual{Harvest {Supper}and{Christmas Social}take place there together with the occasional supper dance and any{public meetings concerning the village. For membership of other clubs it is necessary to travel to the neighbouring villages where can be found the Womens' Institute, youth clubs, young farmers' clubs, cubs, scouts and brownies, gardening club and local history societies.
